Description: Mudstone (greywacke) palette carved in the shape of a fish with drilled eye, incised details on both sides: crescent line around the face, incised mouth, and short incised lines along upper edge of body; one fin in carved on lower body. The tail is contiguous with the outline of the body, partly lost. Single piercing at top.
Curator's comments: Like palette type 47D in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery and Palettes (1921).
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2005-2008, Santa Anna, The Bowers Museum, Death and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt.
